intro: Stephanomeria virgata, commonly known as the white globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its spherical, woolly heads of white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland deserts. Stephanomeria virgata is adapted to arid environments and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
